title: Tadoba tiger that swam two rivers and crossed three States tranquilised in East Godavari

content: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its fourth year, the battlefield is no longer confined to drones and missile strikes along the frontlines. A series of assassinations on Russian soil suggests that a separate conflict is being fought far from borders.

content: A man was crushed to death on Friday when a container fell off a truck in Gujarat's Valsad and landed on a makeshift structure where he was eating.

content: At least 25 labourers were killed on Thursday morning in a suspected dynamite explosion at an illegal coal mine in Meghalaya's East Jaintia Hills district.

content: The "airport sprint" might finally be over. In a major move to eliminate terminal bottlenecks, Mumbai Airport has inaugurated 14 cutting-edge hybrid self-bag drop counters at Terminal 2.

content: A noted realtor from Surat has died of a heart attack days after a suicide attempt ahead of his daughter's wedding.

title: 69 Killed, 169 Injured In Suicide Bombing At Shrine In Islamabad
content: At least 69 people were killed and many were injured after a suicide bomber detonated himself inside a shrine in Pakistan's capital, Islamabad. The explosion occurred at Tarlai Imambargah, situated in the Shehzad Town area of the city.

title: US, Iran Holds Talks In Oman After Trump Military Threats
content: Iran and the United States were holding talks in Oman on Friday that were seen as a critical chance to avert any new escalation between the foes, after President Donald Trump threatened military action.

title: Russia, US To Start Negotiations To Renew Nuclear Treaty Soon: Kremlin
content: Russia and the United States agree that it is necessary to renew nuclear talks, the Kremlin said Friday, after the last treaty limiting Moscow's and Washington's arsenals expired.

title: New START Treaty 'Was Flawed': US Official As Key Nuclear Pact Ends
content: A senior US official on Friday criticised the last nuclear treaty between Russia and the United States for failing to include Beijing, speaking at the United Nations a day after the New START deal expired.

title: 3 Delhi Jal Board Engineers Suspended Over Biker's Death In Pool-Sized Pit
content: Three Delhi Jal Board (DJB) engineers have been suspended after a motorcyclist allegedly fell into a construction pit dug by the water agency, cabinet minister Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma said on Friday.

title: U19 WC Final: Sooryavanshi demolition job leads India to record sixth title
content: India U19 clinched their sixth ICC Under-19 World Cup title with a dominant 100-run win over England U19 at Harare Sports Club. Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi starred with 175 off 80 balls, the fastest 150 in U19 history. India posted 411/9, and despite Caleb Falconerâ€™s 115, England fell short at 311, as Indiaâ€™s bowlers maintained control.

title: â€˜No limits, no transparency, no controlsâ€™: US accuses China of covert nuclear tests
content: The US has accused China of secretly conducting nuclear tests, urging Beijing to join arms control talks as the New START treaty expires. While Russia and the US acknowledge the need for urgent negotiations, China rejects the claims and refuses to participate, citing its smaller arsenal. This raises fears of a new nuclear arms race.

title: â€˜In 36 months, the cheapest place to put AI will be â€¦â€™: Musk makes a bold prediction
content: Elon Musk predicts space will soon host the most cost-effective AI data centers, potentially within three years. He highlighted space's superior solar energy capture, lack of atmospheric interference, and absence of day-night cycles, eliminating the need for batteries. Musk also downplayed concerns about GPU reliability in large-scale AI training, suggesting they become dependable after initial debugging.

title: From Kohli to Mhatre: Check U19 WC winners list as India beat England
content: India U19 claimed their sixth ICC Under-19 World Cup title in 2026, defeating England U19 by 100 runs at Harare Sports Club. Vaibhav Sooryavanshi starred with 175 off 80 balls, while captain Ayush Mhatre and Kanishk Chouhan contributed crucial knocks. Englandâ€™s chase faltered under consistent Indian bowling, handing India a dominant win and extending their rich U19 legacy.

title: US-Iran nuclear talks: Tehran strikes 'positive' note - what was discussed in Oman
content: Iran's foreign minister described mediated talks with the US in Oman as a "good start" for nuclear discussions, expressing optimism for a positive framework if the current path continues. Both sides agreed to further discussions, with Iran conveying its concerns and interests while the US seeks to address its missile program and regional support.

title: Google CEO thinks bloodbath in markets in reaction to Anthropic is overblown
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown. Despite a significant selloff in software stocks triggered by Anthropic's legal AI tools, they argue AI will enhance, not replace, existing software, enabling greater productivity and innovation.

title: Seven Naxals killed in Gadchiroli, including top leader; special force jawan succumbs to injuries
content: Seven Naxals, including top leader Prabhakar with a Rs 25 lakh bounty, were killed in an encounter with Maharashtra police in Gadchiroli. The operation, launched three days ago, also resulted in the death of a special force jawan, Deepak Chinna Madavi, while another jawan is out of danger. The anti-Naxal operation is ongoing.

title: Beyond Mumbai & Goa: How Indiaâ€™s tourism map is quietly changing
content: India's tourism landscape is rapidly evolving beyond beaches and hills. A new generation is flocking to spiritual and heritage sites like Ayodhya and Varanasi, driven by religious revival, infrastructure growth, and social media influence. These destinations are now vibrant, year-round hubs attracting diverse travellers seeking cultural immersion and authentic experiences.

title: How seven new high-speed rail corridors can transform train travel in India
content: The Union Budget 2026 announced seven high-speed rail corridors to enhance travel speed, safety, and comfort. The bullet trains, along with already operational Vande Bharat Sleeper and Amrit Bharat Express trains will improve connectivity and passenger experience.

title: What Amazon CEO said on 'spending plan' that wiped $250bn+ from company stock in a day
content: Amazon's stock saw a significant drop after a massive investment plan for 2026. The company plans to spend $200 billion on infrastructure. This move aims to boost Amazon Web Services' capacity for artificial intelligence. CEO Andy Jassy assured investors these investments will bring strong returns. The company is scaling up data centers and equipment to meet growing demand.

title: Delhi biker's tragic death: Kin say got no help from cops; govt suspends 3 officials - key points
content: Three Delhi Jal Board engineers were suspended after a 25-year-old motorcyclist died falling into an unbarricaded construction pit. The victim's family alleged gross carelessness by the police in their search efforts, claiming they received no timely assistance. Authorities are investigating the incident and safety protocols.

title: Moon-bound again: 4 astronauts will fly farther than anyone since 1970s
content: Four astronauts are set for a 10-day deep-space journey aboard the Artemis II mission, marking humanity's return beyond low-Earth orbit after five decades. This lunar flyby will test new spacecraft and partnerships, validating crucial systems for future lunar landings and Mars missions. The mission prioritizes crew health and scientific observation, paving the way for sustained lunar exploration.

title: Winter Olympics 2026 Snowboarding schedule: dates, medal matches & more
content: Snowboarding is expected to be one of the biggest highlights of the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics. Fans around the world will once again tune in to watch speed, style, and big-air tricks on the Olympic stage. A total of 11 gold medals will be awarded across different snowboarding events. Competition begins on Thursday, February 5, with qualifying runs at Livigno Snow Park in Livigno, Italy.

title: Druski mispronounces Jaxon Smithâ€‘Njigbaâ€™s name at NFL Honors moment
content: Comedian Druski had to bear the brunt of severe backlash for mispronouncing Jaxson Smith-Njigbaâ€™s surname at NFL Honors 2026, with many cybercitizens calling his actions disrespectful, embarrassing, and deliberate clip farming. A cybercitizen also pointed out his ignorance of wide receiver preparing for the Super Bowl in three days, highlighting a lack of respect for the player and the event both.

title: Roman Josiâ€™s luxury watch collection: How the Predators captain became a mogul
content: Nashville Predators captain Roman Josi, renowned for his leadership and defensive prowess, harbors a deep passion for luxury watches.  As a significant investor in the independent Swiss watchmaker NORQAIN, Josi embodies precision and heritage. His curated collection, featuring classic designs, reflects his elegant taste and personal milestones, earning him the moniker 'Swiss watch mogul' among fans.

title: From Misbah's scoop, Brathwaite's sixes to Surya's catch: A T20 WC history
content: As the ICC Menâ€™s T20 World Cup 2026 begins on Saturday across venues in India and Sri Lanka, the tournament marks another chapter in a competition that began 19 years ago. From its first edition in South Africa in 2007 to the 2024 event in the USA and Caribbean, the T20 World Cup has seen the format grow in scale and reach.

title: Sub-zero shock in Manali: Mumbai woman dies after sudden shivering during Solang Valley visit
content: A Mumbai tourist tragically died from suspected cold exposure in Manali's freezing Solang Valley. Meanwhile, Kullu witnessed a rare winter landslide, and avalanches pose a threat in higher altitudes.  A minor earthquake also rattled Kinnaur.  These events highlight the severe weather conditions gripping Himachal Pradesh.

title: K'taka CM row: DKS gets snarky after Sidda's son says no leadership change likely
content: Congress MLC Yathindra Siddaramaiah expressed confidence that his father, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, will complete the full five-year term, citing a clear signal from the party high command. Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar, however, responded sarcastically, suggesting the central leadership should clarify the matter. Speculation about a leadership change has intensified as the government nears its halfway mark

title: Bobby Wagner: NFL star and 2026 Walter Payton Man of the Year winner
content: Washington Commanders LB Bobby Wagner was named the Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year 2026 for his community work. The star credited his achievement to his mother. He established the FAST54 Phenia Mae Fund for stroke education and support, and later expanded it to include pediatric research. Wagner is also involved with initiatives related to social justice, mental health awareness, and tech education for underserved youth.

title: Hack of the day: Use WhatsApp without sharing your phone number publicly
content: Keep your personal phone number private on WhatsApp with these smart hacks. Utilize a secondary SIM or virtual number, or leverage the WhatsApp Business app. You can even link your account to a landline for enhanced privacy and to prevent unwanted contact.

title: Cooper DeJean breaks silence on Nikki Bella dating buzz after WWE Raw
content: Cooper DeJean finally addressed the rumors linking him to WWE star Nikki Bella. While appearing on The Pat McAfee Show, he stated that he does not have a public relationship, and later called Bella a good friend on Kay Adamsâ€™ show.

title: Watch: Sooryavanshi's animated celebration goes viral in U19 WC final
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi produced a breathtaking knock in the U-19 World Cup final, smashing the second-fastest century in tournament history off just 55 balls against England. He went on to score 175, dominating the bowlers, sharing a huge partnership, and earning a standing ovation for one of the greatest U-19 innings ever.

title: 'Blew himself up': What we know about Pakistan suicide bomb blast
content: A devastating suicide bombing at a Shia mosque in Islamabad, Pakistan, claimed at least 31 lives and injured over 160 during Friday prayers. The attacker detonated himself after being stopped at the imambargah's gate. Authorities are investigating the incident, with initial reports suggesting foreign links. This attack follows recent violence in the region.

title: U19 WC final: Sooryavanshi smashes 55-ball century, puts India in command
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi smashed a blistering 55-ball century in the Under-19 World Cup final against England, setting a new record for most sixes in the tournament. His explosive innings, featuring eight fours and as many sixes, helped India post a strong total after winning the toss and electing to bat.

title: 'People laughed & made fun of me': 19-yr-old farmer shares how he fought odds to become model
content: Hailing from Aligarh, Nitin Kumar defied village expectations to pursue a modeling dream. Facing ridicule and financial hardship, he juggled multiple jobs, from security guard to airport worker, to fund his aspirations. Through relentless practice and social media vlogs, Nitin eventually landed his first paid shows, proving that perseverance can overcome humble beginnings and societal doubts.

title: Prakash Raj slams Kangana Ranaut's remarks on AR Rahman
content: Prakash Raj defended AR Rahman against Kangana Ranaut's criticism, highlighting the music maestro's achievements and questioning the backlash. Ranaut had accused Rahman of being prejudiced and hateful after he refused to compose for her film 'Emergency', which she called a masterpiece. Rahman later clarified his intentions were to uplift through music.

title: Use AI for guidance, not dependency, says PM Modi at Pariksha Pe Charcha 2026
content: At Pariksha Pe Charcha 2026, Prime Minister Narendra Modi described Artificial Intelligence as a helpful tool for students but warned against overdependence. He said AI can guide learning, such as recommending biographies, but cannot replace effort or discipline. Emphasising responsible use, he urged students to combine technology with critical thinking and active study habits.

title: Stock market: Here are the top gainers and losers on NSE, BSE today - check list
content: Indian equity markets closed higher Friday, with the Sensex and Nifty gaining ground. The Reserve Bank of India maintained interest rates and proposed allowing banks to lend to REITs, a move expected to boost the real estate sector. Despite a volatile session, late buying in select stocks, particularly FMCG and private banking, drove the recovery.

title: Manipur erupts in protest after MLA Nemcha Kipgen joins NDA govt as deputy CM
content: Protests erupted in Manipur's Churachandpur after Kuki-Zo MLA Nemcha Kipgen accepted a deputy CM role, sparking backlash. The Kuki Zo Council declared a social boycott of community legislators joining the government. Burning tyres and road blockades signaled renewed unrest, with calls for a shutdown in Kuki Zo-majority areas.

title: 14-year-old Rohingya boy taunted over â€˜refugeeâ€™ status, stabbed to death after quarrel in Delhi
content: A 14-year-old Rohingya boy died after being stabbed multiple times in Delhi's Khajuri Khas following an argument. The victim's father reported that the altercation began when a group allegedly hurled "refugee" slurs at his son and his friends. Four teenagers have been arrested in connection with the incident.

title: Travis Kelce loses major NFL honor as retirement rumors swirl
content: Travis Kelce didnâ€™t end up winning the Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year Award at NFL Honors, despite being the Chiefsâ€™ nominee. The honor went to Commanders linebacker Bobby Wagner, who delivered an emotional speech thanking his parents. Kelceâ€™s loss comes at a time when retirement rumors grow, and a decision hasnâ€™t been made by the tight end.

title: Madras High Court verdict: Vijayâ€™s Rs 1.5cr tax penalty upheld; can appeal to tribunal
content: Madras High Court has upheld a Rs 1.5 crore income tax penalty against actor Vijay, dismissing his petition. The court found no grounds for interference, endorsing the Income Tax Department's stance on undisclosed income from the film 'Puli'. Meanwhile, Vijay's film 'Jana Nayagan' faces release delays due to censor and legal issues.

title: 'Ghee made from bathroom-cleaning chemicals': Naidu slams previous Jagan govt over Tirupati laddus
content: Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu alleged that the previous YSRCP government used ghee adulterated with "bathroom-cleaning chemicals" in the preparation of Tirupati laddus. He claimed this practice, which allegedly lasted for nearly five years, undermined the sanctity of the Tirumala temple and also affected the Srisailam temple.

title: No more seat-sharing: Why Congress high command chose to go solo in Bengal assembly elections
content: The Congress has decided to contest the 2026 Bengal assembly polls independently, ending its decade-long alliance with the Left Front. The party will field candidates in all 294 seats, a decision influenced by the aspirations of party workers and a collective leadership consensus. This move sets the stage for a four-cornered electoral contest in the state.

title: Matthew Tkachuk, Victor Hedman clash after JJ Moser incident
content: During a tense moment in the game between the Florida Panthers and the Tampa Bay Lightning, Matthew Tkachuk got into a fight with JJ Moser. Victor Hedman then stepped in. The incident quickly made headlines in NHL news, sparking discussions about physical play, how players reacted, and sportsmanship.

title: â€˜Cannot force to continue pregnancyâ€™: SC allows abortion of 30-week pregnant minor â€” why it matters
content: The Supreme Court has permitted a 17-year-old to terminate her 30-week pregnancy, emphasizing a minor's right to decide against continuing a pregnancy. Justices Nagarathna and Ujjal Bhuyan directed JJ Hospital to proceed with the termination, prioritizing the girl's reproductive autonomy and her clear unwillingness to carry the pregnancy to term.

title: Malayalam actor accused of hit-and-run outside Trivandrum club; 2 bikers injured
content: A car, reportedly driven by actor Maniyanpilla Raju, allegedly struck a motorcycle and fled the scene after exiting the Trivandrum Club late Thursday. Two individuals on the two-wheeler sustained injuries and were hospitalized. The actor has reportedly pledged to cooperate with investigators and appear on Friday morning.

title: T20 World Cup: Siraj to join India T20I squad in Mumbai today; Rana all but ruled out
content: Mohammed Siraj is all set to fly to Mumbai today to link up with T20I squad before Indiaâ€™s World Cup opener vs USA. Harshit Rana is expected to miss out on the T20 World Cup due to a knee injury that he picked up in the warm-up match against South Africa.

title: Mercedes-Benz V-Class launch on March 3: Five things you need to know!
content: Globally, the Mercedes- Benz V-Class is offered with a 2.0-litre, four-cylinder diesel turbo engine in two configurations - 220d, with 163hp and 380Nm, and the more powerful 300d, with 237hp and 500Nm. Both engines come paired with a 9-speed automatic transmission. Itâ€™s offered with both rear-wheel drive and all-wheel drive options.

content: the 2026 trade deadline is officially over, and a flurry of deals has shaken up both conferences with just a few months left in the regular season . the lakers were on the move this week, with James Harden heading to the Cleveland Cavaliers in exchange for darius Garland .

content: snubs, injuries and countries not participating bolster debate about the tournament . the theme of this week's Power Rankings is who is the "top" player from each NHL team that isn't on an Olympic roster going to Milan . it's quite possible that Nichushkin would have also been boarding a plane overseas .

content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India.
